methods.notes: The primary method for programmatic access to Jira Cloud data. Supports comprehensive CRUD operations on issues, projects, users, workflows, and more. API Token is recommended for scripts and integrations, OAuth 2.0 for applications.
setup_requirements: Generate an API token from your Atlassian account settings (for API Token auth)
Register an OAuth 2.0 client application (for OAuth 2.0 auth)
Ensure the user/API token has appropriate permissions in Jira

methods.endpoint: N/A (Jira sends to your specified URL)
methods.notes: Provides real-time notifications for events occurring in Jira (e.g., issue created, updated, deleted, comment added). Requires an external endpoint (your server/service) to receive JSON payloads.
setup_requirements: Configure a webhook in Jira's system settings (requires Jira admin permissions)
Provide a publicly accessible URL for Jira to send webhook payloads to
Implement an endpoint to receive and process incoming JSON payloads

methods.notes: Allows users to manually export issue data from search results directly from the Jira UI. Common formats include CSV (for spreadsheets), XML, and JSON. Limited to the issues and fields displayed in the search results.
setup_requirements: Access to Jira Cloud via a web browser
Permissions to view the issues intended for export
Perform an issue search to filter the desired data

methods.auth_type: OAuth 2.0 or API Token (managed by the platform's connector)
methods.notes: Low-code/no-code platforms that provide pre-built connectors to Jira, enabling easy automation of workflows and data synchronization between Jira and hundreds of other applications without custom coding. They abstract away the complexities of the Jira API.
setup_requirements: Account on the chosen integration platform (e.g., Zapier, Make.com)
Connect your Jira instance to the platform (typically requires Jira admin permissions or user consent via OAuth)
Configure 'Zaps' or 'Scenarios' to define data flow and triggers

methods.auth_type: OAuth 2.0 (Web Server Flow, User-Agent Flow, JWT Bearer Flow, etc.)
methods.notes: Standard API for programmatic access to Salesforce data and metadata. Supports SOQL queries, DML operations, and various resource types. Ideal for real-time, record-level integrations and retrieving small to medium datasets.
setup_requirements: Create a Connected App in Salesforce for OAuth 2.0 authentication.
Configure appropriate OAuth scopes (e.g., 'api', 'refresh_token').
Obtain Consumer Key and Consumer Secret from the Connected App.
Implement an OAuth flow to obtain an access token for API calls.

methods.notes: Asynchronous API optimized for processing large sets of data (millions of records). Ideal for batch data loads, migrations, and large-scale data exports. Bulk API 2.0 is simpler and recommended for new implementations.
setup_requirements: Create a Connected App in Salesforce for OAuth 2.0 authentication.
Configure appropriate OAuth scopes (e.g., 'api').
Obtain Consumer Key and Consumer Secret from the Connected App.
Implement an OAuth flow to obtain an access token for API calls.

methods.notes: Built-in Salesforce feature for scheduled (weekly/monthly) or on-demand export of all or selected Salesforce data as CSV files. Files are zipped and can be downloaded directly from Salesforce, delivered via email, or SFTP. Primarily used for backup and archival purposes.
setup_requirements: Navigate to Setup -> Data -> Data Export in Salesforce.
Schedule export frequency (weekly/monthly) and select objects to include.
Ensure sufficient storage space for exported files on the Salesforce server or designated SFTP location.

methods.method_name: Salesforce Change Data Capture (CDC) / Platform Events
methods.endpoint: N/A (events published to a message bus, consumed via Streaming API or external platform)
methods.auth_type: OAuth 2.0 (requires 'api' scope for Streaming API client)
methods.notes: Provides near real-time event streams for changes to Salesforce records (CDC) or custom events (Platform Events). Events can be consumed by external systems using the Streaming API (CometD protocol) or by other Salesforce features (Flows, Apex). Ideal for real-time synchronization and event-driven architectures.
setup_requirements: Enable Change Data Capture for desired standard and custom objects in Salesforce Setup.
Define custom Platform Events if needed for specific business processes.
Create a Connected App for OAuth 2.0 authentication.
Implement a client application to subscribe to event streams using the Streaming API (e.g., a CometD client).

methods.notes: Leverages pre-built connectors on Integration Platform as a Service (iPaaS) platforms to integrate Salesforce with hundreds of other applications without extensive coding. Supports triggers (e.g., new record, updated record) and actions (e.g., create, update, search). Ideal for non-developers or quick, low-code integrations.
setup_requirements: Create an account on the chosen iPaaS platform (e.g., Zapier, Make.com, Workato).
Connect the Salesforce account to the iPaaS platform (typically via an OAuth flow initiated by the iPaaS).
Configure triggers and actions within the iPaaS workflow builder to define data extraction and transformation logic.

methods.auth_type: OAuth 2.0 (Web Server Flow, User-Agent Flow, JWT Bearer Flow, etc.)
methods.notes: Standard API for programmatic access to Salesforce data and metadata. Supports SOQL queries, DML operations, and various resource types. Ideal for real-time, record-level integrations and retrieving small to medium datasets.
setup_requirements: Create a Connected App in Salesforce for OAuth 2.0 authentication.
Configure appropriate OAuth scopes (e.g., 'api', 'refresh_token').
Obtain Consumer Key and Consumer Secret from the Connected App.
Implement an OAuth flow to obtain an access token for API calls.

Obtain Consumer Key and Consumer Secret from the Connected App.
Implement an OAuth flow to obtain an access token for API calls.

setup_requirements: Navigate to Setup -> Data -> Data Export in Salesforce.
Schedule export frequency (weekly/monthly) and select objects to include.
Ensure sufficient storage space for exported files on the Salesforce server or designated SFTP location.

methods.notes: Leverages pre-built connectors on Integration Platform as a Service (iPaaS) platforms to integrate Salesforce with hundreds of other applications without extensive coding. Supports triggers (e.g., new record, updated record) and actions (e.g., create, update, search). Ideal for non-developers or quick, low-code integrations.
setup_requirements: Create an account on the chosen iPaaS platform (e.g., Zapier, Make.com, Workato).
Connect the Salesforce account to the iPaaS platform (typically via an OAuth flow initiated by the iPaaS).
Configure triggers and actions within the iPaaS workflow builder to define data extraction and transformation logic.

methods.auth_type: Basic Authentication (API Key & Application ID) or OAuth 2.0
methods.notes: Comprehensive access to employee data, payroll, time off, and more. Supports CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations for various HR entities. This is the most flexible and powerful method for programmatic data extraction and manipulation.
setup_requirements: Obtain an API Key and Application ID from Hibob admin settings.
Configure appropriate permissions for the API user/application within Hibob.
Familiarity with RESTful API concepts and JSON data formats.

methods.endpoint: N/A (Hibob pushes to your configured endpoint)
methods.auth_type: Shared Secret (for signature verification) and API Key (for webhook creation)
methods.notes: Provides real-time notifications for specific events occurring within Hibob, such as new hires, terminations, profile updates, or time off requests. Requires an external, publicly accessible endpoint to receive the webhook payloads.
setup_requirements: Configure webhook subscriptions in Hibob admin settings or via the API.
Provide a publicly accessible URL where Hibob can send event data.
Implement a mechanism to receive and process incoming HTTP POST requests.
Implement signature verification using the shared secret for security and authenticity.

methods.notes: Allows manual export of various reports and employee data directly from the Hibob web interface. Typically available in common formats like CSV or Excel. This method is suitable for ad-hoc data dumps or for users without technical integration capabilities.
setup_requirements: Active Hibob user account with appropriate permissions to access and export data.
Access to the Hibob web portal.

methods.notes: Leverages pre-built connectors on iPaaS (Integration Platform as a Service) platforms like Zapier or Make.com to simplify integration with hundreds of other applications without requiring custom code. Ideal for automating common workflows (e.g., syncing new hires to an HRIS, updating contact lists).
setup_requirements: Active Zapier or Make.com account.
Connect your Hibob account within the chosen iPaaS platform using the provided OAuth flow.
Configure 'Zaps' (Zapier) or 'Scenarios' (Make.com) to define data flow and triggers/actions.

methods.auth_type: Personal Access Token (PAT), Tableau Connected Apps (OAuth 2.0)
methods.notes: Allows programmatic access to published data sources, workbooks, and views. Can download data extracts (.hyper files) or CSV data from views. Requires site administrator or appropriate permissions. This is the primary method for automated data extraction.
setup_requirements: Generate Personal Access Token or configure Connected App on Tableau Server/Cloud.
Ensure user account has appropriate permissions (e.g., Explorer, Creator, Site Admin).
Identify site ID if using multi-site environment.

methods.notes: Allows users to manually export underlying or summarized data from a Tableau view or workbook to CSV or Excel (crosstab). Also supports PDF and image exports. Limited by view filters and user permissions.
setup_requirements: Access to Tableau Desktop, Tableau Server, or Tableau Cloud.
Permissions to view the specific workbook/view and download data.

methods.notes: A low-level API for programmatic creation, reading, and writing of .hyper files (Tableau's in-memory data engine). Useful for building custom data pipelines that interact directly with Tableau's native data format. Can be used to extract data from existing .hyper files downloaded via the REST API.
setup_requirements: Install Tableau Hyper API library (available for Python, Java, C++, Node.js).
Access to .hyper files (e.g., downloaded via REST API or generated locally).

methods.notes: Webhooks notify an external system about events in Tableau (e.g., data source refresh complete, workbook published). While they don't directly output data, they are crucial for triggering subsequent data extraction processes (e.g., via REST API) when data is updated or ready.
setup_requirements: Configure a webhook listener endpoint on an external server.
Create webhook subscription on Tableau Server/Cloud for desired events.
Implement logic to process webhook payload and trigger data extraction using other methods (e.g., REST API).
Optional: Configure shared secret for payload verification to ensure authenticity.

methods.notes: Provides programmatic access to Power BI resources including datasets, reports, dashboards, and dataflows. Can be used to query dataset rows, refresh datasets, manage gateways, and more. Requires an Azure AD application registration for authentication.
setup_requirements: Register an application in Azure Active Directory
Grant necessary API permissions (e.g., Dataset.Read.All, Report.Read.All)
Obtain an OAuth 2.0 access token for authentication

methods.method_name: Direct Export from Power BI Service/Desktop (CSV, Excel, PDF, PPTX)
methods.notes: Users can directly export data from visuals within reports to CSV or Excel files. Entire reports can also be exported to PDF or PowerPoint formats from the Power BI Service. This is a user-interface driven method.
setup_requirements: Access to a Power BI report in Power BI Service or Power BI Desktop
Export permissions enabled by the report creator or Power BI administrator

methods.notes: Allows direct read/write connectivity to Power BI datasets hosted in Premium, Premium Per User (PPU), or Embedded capacities. Enables tools like SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS), DAX Studio, Excel, or custom applications to query the underlying tabular data model using MDX or DAX.
setup_requirements: Power BI Premium, Premium Per User (PPU), or Embedded capacity
XMLA endpoint read/write enabled in Power BI tenant settings
Service Principal or user account with appropriate workspace/dataset permissions

methods.method_name: Power Automate Flows for Data Extraction
methods.auth_type: OAuth 2.0 (Power Automate connection to Power BI)
methods.notes: Power Automate (formerly Microsoft Flow) can be triggered by Power BI data alerts or on a schedule. It can then use the built-in Power BI connector actions (e.g., 'Run a query against a dataset') or HTTP actions to call the Power BI REST API directly, enabling extraction and pushing of data to other services (e.g., SharePoint, SQL Database, Azure Blob Storage).
setup_requirements: Power Automate license
Power BI Pro/Premium license for dataset access
Create a Power Automate flow
Configure Power BI connection within Power Automate

methods.method_name: Power BI Dataflows Output to Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2
methods.auth_type: Azure AD (Service Principal or Managed Identity for ADLS Gen2)
methods.notes: Power BI Dataflows (available in Premium/PPU capacities) can be configured to store their processed data entities directly into an organization's Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2 account. The data is stored in CDM (Common Data Model) format, making it accessible for other Azure services, analytics tools, or custom applications.
setup_requirements: Power BI Premium or PPU capacity
Azure Data Lake Storage Gen2 account
Configure Power BI tenant settings for Data Lake connection
Create a Power BI Dataflow and configure its output settings

methods.notes: Comprehensive API for managing most Magento entities (products, orders, customers, categories, etc.). Supports CRUD operations. Ideal for programmatic integration and data synchronization with external systems.
setup_requirements: Create a new Integration in Magento Admin (System > Integrations)
Activate the Integration and generate an access token
Configure resource access permissions for the Integration

methods.auth_type: Customer Tokens, Admin Tokens (for specific operations), or Unauthenticated (for public data)
methods.notes: Introduced in Magento 2.3.0. Offers a single endpoint for querying specific data, reducing over-fetching. Ideal for storefront development (e.g., PWA Studio) and efficient data retrieval.
setup_requirements: Ensure Magento 2.3.0 or later is installed
For authenticated access, generate customer or admin tokens via REST API or login

methods.notes: Manual process accessible from the Magento Admin Panel. Supports exporting various data types like Products, Customers, and Orders into CSV format. Useful for one-time data dumps or manual data transfers.
setup_requirements: Access to Magento Admin Panel with appropriate user roles (e.g., Administrator, Data Exporter)

methods.endpoint: N/A (Configured by custom module to external system)
methods.auth_type: N/A (Authentication to external endpoint handled by custom module logic)
methods.notes: Leverages Magento's robust event dispatching system (e.g., `sales_order_place_after`, `catalog_product_save_after`). Requires custom module development or a third-party extension to listen to specific events and push data to an external webhook endpoint. Provides real-time or near real-time updates.
setup_requirements: Developer expertise to create a custom Magento module to listen to events and send data
Alternatively, install and configure a third-party webhook extension from Magento Marketplace

methods.notes: Comprehensive programmatic access to all major data entities (e.g., prospects, accounts, sequences, emails, calls, tasks) for read, write, and update operations. Ideal for building custom integrations, data warehousing, and large-scale data synchronization.
setup_requirements: Register an application in the Outreach Developer Portal to obtain Client ID and Client Secret.
Implement the OAuth 2.0 authorization code flow to acquire access tokens for user authentication.

methods.notes: Real-time notifications for specific events occurring within Outreach.io, such as prospect creation/updates, email sent/opened, call logged, etc. Requires an external endpoint to receive HTTP POST requests.
setup_requirements: Configure webhook subscriptions via the Outreach API, specifying the event types and your callback URL.
Provide a publicly accessible HTTPS endpoint to receive webhook payloads.
Implement signature verification using the provided shared secret to ensure payload authenticity.

methods.notes: Manual export of various data types (e.g., prospects, accounts, sequences, emails, calls) directly from the Outreach.io web interface. Data is typically downloaded as a CSV file. Suitable for ad-hoc data dumps or smaller datasets, but not for automated or large-scale integration.
setup_requirements: Access to the Outreach.io web application with appropriate user permissions to view and export desired data.

methods.notes: Leverages pre-built connectors on popular integration platforms to automate workflows and synchronize data between Outreach.io and hundreds of other business applications (e.g., CRMs, marketing automation tools). Ideal for non-developers or rapid integration needs.
setup_requirements: An active account with a supported integration platform (e.g., Zapier, Make.com, Workato).
Connect your Outreach.io account within the chosen platform, typically using OAuth for secure authorization.

methods.notes: Comprehensive API for interacting with messages, channels, users, files, and more. Requires creating a Slack app and managing OAuth scopes for permissions. Supports various methods for data retrieval (e.g., conversations.history, users.list).

Allows workspace administrators to export a ZIP file containing public and private channel messages, direct messages, and files. Data is typically in JSON format. Different export types (Standard, Corporate, Discovery) offer varying levels of data granularity.

Provides real-time notifications of events happening in a Slack workspace (e.g., new messages, channel changes, user activity). Requires setting up a Slack app and subscribing to specific event types, with Slack sending JSON payloads to a configured URL.

Leverages pre-built integrations on platforms like Zapier or Make.com to connect Slack with hundreds of other applications. These platforms abstract the underlying API complexities, allowing for no-code/low-code automation and data flow between systems.
Comprehensive API for programmatic access to all major data entities (prospects, accounts, sequences, activities, etc.). Supports CRUD operations.
Allows users to export lists of prospects, accounts, sequences, and reports directly from the web application in CSV or XLSX format.
Real-time notifications for events such as prospect updates, email activities (sent, opened, clicked, replied), and task completions. Requires an external listener.
No-code/low-code integration platform for connecting Outreach with hundreds of other applications, enabling automated workflows and data synchronization.

Real-time notifications for events such as prospect updates, email activities (sent, opened, clicked, replied), and task completions. Requires an external listener.
No-code/low-code integration platform for connecting Outreach with hundreds of other applications, enabling automated workflows and data synchronization.
Programmatic access to read, write, and update records. Supports filtering, sorting, and pagination. Official SDKs available for various languages.
Manual export of a view's data directly from the Airtable user interface as a Comma Separated Values (CSV) file.

methods.auth_type: API Key (for setup), Signature Verification (for receiving)
methods.notes: Real-time notifications for record changes (create, update, delete) in a base, pushed to a user-defined callback URL.
Leverages pre-built connectors on platforms like Zapier, Make.com (formerly Integromat), and Workato to automate data transfer and workflows with thousands of other applications without writing code.
Custom JavaScript code within Airtable Automations can be used to fetch data from Airtable and send it to external services via HTTP requests, triggered by various events.

Programmatic access to Notion pages, databases, blocks, and users. Supports CRUD operations.
Users can manually export individual pages or entire databases directly from the Notion UI. Formats include CSV (for databases), PDF, HTML, and Markdown.
Receive real-time notifications for changes to Notion pages, databases, and users. Ideal for keeping external systems synchronized.
Leverage low-code/no-code platforms to connect Notion with hundreds of other applications for automated workflows, data synchronization, and reporting without custom code.
Comprehensive API for programmatic access to all Stripe resources including payments, customers, subscriptions, products, and more. Supports standard RESTful operations (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE).

Real-time notifications for events occurring in your Stripe account (e.g., charge succeeded, invoice paid, subscription created). Requires setting up an endpoint to receive POST requests and verifying the webhook signature.

Allows users to manually export various reports and data sets (e.g., payments, payouts, balance changes, customer lists) directly from the Stripe Dashboard as CSV files for analysis or import into other systems.

Stripe offers a marketplace of pre-built integrations and connectors with popular third-party tools such as accounting software (e.g., Xero, QuickBooks), CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce), and e-commerce platforms (e.g., Shopify). These often use OAuth for secure data exchange.

Programmatic access to aggregated report data, including metrics, dimensions, segments, and calculated metrics. Used for building custom dashboards, integrating with BI tools, and automating report generation.

methods.method_name: Adobe Analytics Data Feeds (Raw Data Export)
methods.notes: Exports raw, hit-level data in a structured format (e.g., TSV, CSV) to an SFTP server. Essential for deep analysis, data warehousing, and custom data processing outside of Adobe Analytics.

methods.method_name: Adobe Experience Platform (AEP) Data Access API
methods.notes: If Adobe Analytics data is ingested into Adobe Experience Platform (AEP), this API allows programmatic access to raw or processed data files stored within AEP datasets. Provides a unified way to access data from various Adobe sources.
